Company: Mid-America Pipeline Company LLC and Enterprise Products Operating LLC
Description: Mid-America Pipeline Company LLC (MAPCO), and Enterprise Products Operating LLC, of Houston, agreed to pay a civil penalty of more than $1 million to the United States to settle violations of the federal Clean Water Act related to three natural gasoline pipeline spills in Iowa, Kansas and Nebraska. The companies also agreed to undertake various measures aimed at reducing external threats to their pipeline, enhance their reporting of spills, and spend at least $200,000 to identify and prevent external threats to the pipeline involved in the spills.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Info Source: PIPELINE FIRM PLEADS GUILTY TO ENVIRONMENTAL VIOLATION, AGREES TO PAY $1 MILLION IN AMMONIA PIPELINE RUPTURE, US Fed News, September 4, 2007 (via Nexis).

Company: MID AMERICA PIPELINE COMPANY LLC/ENTERPRISE PRODUC
Info Source: Extracted from a download of the EPA's Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) ICIS FE&C file downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at http://echo.epa.gov/tools/data-downloads#downloads
Notes: Note: This penalty is a duplicate of an amount shown in another record (either because it applies to a multi-location settlement or because Violation Tracker contains an agency record and a settlement announcement for the same case).
